bio:treatment.description: Plants medium-sized, yellowish green to brown. Stems 5 cm, creeping to erect, julaceous, densely to loosely pinnate. Leaves straight to weakly falcate, ovate or widely oblong, abruptly narrowed to apex; margins subentire; <laminal cells 40–50 × 5–6 µm>. Branch leaves 1–1.4 × 0.2–0.4 mm or slightly smaller.
Horizontal surfaces, strongly illuminated sites, especially in mountains and at higher latitudes;
N.W.T., Yukon; Alaska, Colo.; Europe; Indian Ocean Islands (Kerguelen Islands).
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety julaceum sometimes has asymmetric stems. The branches are 0.2–1.5 cm; the leaves are concave.
